availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Josiah B. Browder (Hopkins County, KY, farm laborer )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farm laborer. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Browder and Pernetta Browder. Student in Hopkins County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farm laborer and student in Hopkins County in 1860. Household owned five enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 129B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 717.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 650.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 212.
